p: Vaccination is the most effective method to prevent influenza virus infection. Growing evidence suggests that host factors including host genetics, the hormonal milieu, and gut microbiota play important roles as modifiers of influenza virus vaccine efficacy [ 16]. We are curious to know whether there is an association between IFITM3 and antibody response after TIV immunization. In this study, we recruited 171 healthy young adult volunteers who received TIV and observed the seroconversion rates (SCRs) for H1N1, H3N2 and B viruses. SCRs were found to be lower in donors with IFITM3 rs12252-C/C genotype compared with rs12252-C/T or T/T genotype. We also found a lower level antibody after TIV booster in Ifitm3 -/- mice. Further analysis of germinal centre (GC) B cell and plasma cell indicated a similar reduction in Ifitm3 -/- mice. These findings suggest IFITM may affect the antibody response after influenza vaccination.
